cells

Interface Cell

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BigCell, GooseCell, NormalCell, StartCell, TeleportCell, TrapCell, WaitCell

    public interface Cell
    Interface for the cells of the "jeu de l'oie" game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canBeLeft() 
      int getIndex()
      returns the index of this cell
      java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
      gets the player in this cell null if none
      int handleMove(int diceThrow)
      returns the index of the cell really reached by a player when the player reaches this cell.
      boolean isBusy()
      returns true if a player is in this cell
      void leave(Player player)
      Handles a player leaving a cell
      void nextTurn()
      Notifies the cell the game passes to a new turn
      java.lang.String toString() 
      void welcomePlayer(Player player)
      handles what happens when a player arrives in this cell

    • Method Detail

      • canBeLeft

        boolean canBeLeft()
        Returns:
        true if and only if the player in this cell can freely leaves the cell, else he must wait for another player to reach this cell or wait a given number of turns

      • getIndex

        int getIndex()
        returns the index of this cell
        Returns:
        the index of the cell

      • handleMove

        int handleMove(int diceThrow)
        returns the index of the cell really reached by a player when the player reaches this cell. For normal cells, the returned value equals getIndex() and is thus independent from diceThrow.
        Parameters:
        diceThrow - the result of the dice when the player reaches this cell
        Returns:
        the index of the actual cell where the player eventually arrives when the given throw of dice sends the player in this cell

      • isBusy

        boolean isBusy()
        returns true if a player is in this cell
        Returns:
        if the cell is busy

      • welcomePlayer

        void welcomePlayer(Player player)
        handles what happens when a player arrives in this cell
        Parameters:
        player - the new player in the cell

      • leave

        void leave(Player player)
        Handles a player leaving a cell
        Parameters:
        player - : the player leaving

      • nextTurn

        void nextTurn()
        Notifies the cell the game passes to a new turn

      • getPlayers

        java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
        gets the player in this cell null if none
        Returns:
        list of current players in the cell

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
